document.masterDocTitle: Shallow-water Comatulids (Echinodermata: Crinoidea) from Ambon and Lombok Islands, Indonesia

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined.
8 specimens .
Ambon Is.
NSMT E-8109 ( 1 specimen ), Pombo I
.,
lagoon,
November 27, 1992
; NSMT E-8126 (2), E-8130 (1), E-8135 (1), E-8136 (1), Pombo I
.,
10 m
,
November 28, 1992
; NSMT E-8162 (1), Silale ,
15 m
,
December 2, 1992
.
Lombok Is.
NSMT E-8224 (1), Gili Air I
. February 5, 1994 .

Description. Centrodorsal large, hemispherical or globular, 8–14 mm across, 3–4.5 mm thick with cirrus sockets in 2–3 crowded rows. Cirri very stout, XXX–LVII, 25–33, 22– 40 mm long. Longest cirrals (6 th –14 th ) as long as wide; succeeding cirrals shorter than wide; distal cirrals with blunt aboral tubercle. Radials wholly concealed by centrodorsal. IBr 2: Ibr 1 excessively short; Ibr 2 (axil) low pentagonal, in close to laterally. IIBr–VBr 4(3+4), rarely 2, free laterally. Arms 40–80, 80– 150 mm long; first syzygy at br 3+4 . PII longest, 22–30 mm long, of 56–62 segments; combs of 10–14 teeth non-confluent, with pointed tip. Pinnule combs to P 3 – P 4 .
